name: Rose
details: Roses are classic flowering plants known for their vibrant colors and fragrant blossoms. They thrive in sunny locations and need regular pruning.
watering_reminder: Water in the morning to avoid mildew.
care_tips: Prune regularly to encourage new growth.

name: Lavender
details: Lavender is a fragrant herb with purple flowers. It's drought-tolerant once established and great for attracting pollinators like bees.
watering_reminder: Water infrequently once established.
care_tips: Prune after blooming to maintain shape.

name: Tomato
details: Tomatoes are popular fruiting plants grown for their edible produce. They need plenty of sunlight and frequent watering for optimal growth.
watering_reminder: Water deeply to avoid splashing leaves.
care_tips: Prune bottom leaves for better airflow.

name: Basil
details: Basil is an aromatic herb commonly used in cooking. It grows quickly and thrives in warm, sunny conditions with regular watering.
watering_reminder: Water consistently but don't overwater.
care_tips: Pinch off flowers to encourage more leaf growth.

name: Mint
details: Mint is a vigorous herb that grows well in moist, shady environments. It's perfect for making teas and garnishing dishes.
watering_reminder: Water frequently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Contain mint in a pot to prevent it from spreading.

name: Sunflower
details: Sunflowers are tall, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. They need full sun and regular watering to grow tall and strong.
watering_reminder: Water deeply, especially during flowering.
care_tips: Stake tall varieties to prevent bending.

name: Zucchini
details: Zucchini is a fast-growing vegetable that produces a high yield. It thrives in warm conditions and requires frequent watering to prevent drying out.
watering_reminder: Water consistently, but avoid overwatering.
care_tips: Pick zucchini early for better flavor.

name: Cucumber
details: Cucumbers are refreshing fruits that grow quickly in warm conditions. They need consistent watering and plenty of sunlight.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to avoid bitter taste.
care_tips: Harvest when fruit is firm and green.

name: Marigold
details: Marigolds are bright, cheerful flowers that thrive in sunny gardens. They are often used to repel pests and add color to garden beds.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep flowers vibrant.
care_tips: Deadhead flowers regularly to encourage more blooms.

name: Cilantro
details: Cilantro is a herb with aromatic leaves used in many culinary dishes. It grows best in cooler weather and needs regular watering.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest leaves before they flower to get the best flavor.

name: Thyme
details: Thyme is a fragrant, drought-tolerant herb commonly used in Mediterranean cooking. It thrives in sunny spots with well-drained soil and is ideal for garden beds or containers.
watering_reminder: Allow soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Prune regularly to encourage bushier growth and prevent woodiness.

name: Peppers
details: Peppers come in various types, from sweet bell peppers to hot chili peppers. They require full sun and moderate watering for optimal fruiting.
watering_reminder: Ensure consistent watering, especially in hot weather.
care_tips: Pick peppers when they are fully colored and firm.

name: Oregano
details: Oregano is a hardy herb used in many Mediterranean dishes. It prefers well-drained soil and a sunny location.
watering_reminder: Water occasionally to maintain dryness between waterings.
care_tips: Cut back after flowering to maintain plant health.

name: Chives
details: Chives are a mild-flavored herb commonly used to garnish dishes. They grow well in cooler climates and need consistent watering.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Cut back after flowering for a fresh growth of leaves.

name: Lettuce
details: Lettuce is a cool-season crop that grows best in partial shade. It requires regular watering to keep its leaves crisp and tender.
watering_reminder: Water frequently to maintain crispness.
care_tips: Pick leaves early for best flavor.

name: Spinach
details: Spinach is a nutrient-rich leafy green that thrives in cool weather. It grows quickly and is ideal for early spring and fall planting.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during germination.
care_tips: Harvest outer leaves regularly to encourage continuous growth.

name: Arugula
details: Arugula is a fast-growing, peppery-flavored leafy green, ideal for salads. It thrives in cooler temperatures and can be harvested multiple times.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain consistent soil moisture.
care_tips: Harvest leaves when young for the best flavor; older leaves can become bitter.

name: Swiss Chard
details: Swiss Chard is a colorful leafy vegetable known for its bright stems and nutritious leaves. It grows well in both cool and warm conditions.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Harvest outer leaves regularly to promote new growth.

name: Kale
details: Kale is a hardy leafy green packed with nutrients. It thrives in cooler temperatures and can withstand light frosts, which enhance its flavor.
watering_reminder: Ensure consistent moisture, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest outer leaves first; frost can improve flavor.

name: Mustard Greens
details: Mustard Greens are fast-growing, peppery-tasting leaves that thrive in cool weather. They are rich in vitamins and add a spicy kick to dishes.
watering_reminder: Ensure consistent moisture, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest outer leaves first; frost can improve flavor.

name: Potato
details: Potatoes are starchy tubers that grow underground. They prefer cool weather and well-drained soil with consistent moisture.
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist, especially during tuber formation.
care_tips: Hill soil around the base of plants as they grow to protect tubers from sunlight.

name: Sorrel
details: Sorrel is a tangy leafy green used in soups and salads. It prefers cool weather and consistently moist soil.
soil_type: moist, well-drained, rich in organic matter
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist for best flavor.
care_tips: Harvest young leaves regularly to promote new growth.

name: Radicchio
details: Radicchio is a bitter red leafy vegetable often used in salads. It thrives in cooler seasons and develops deeper color in cold weather.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain crisp texture.
care_tips: Exposing to light frost improves flavor and color.

name: Carrots
details: Carrots are root vegetables known for their crisp texture and sweet flavor. They grow best in loose, sandy soil and cool temperatures.
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Thin seedlings early to prevent crowding.

name: Beets
details: Beets are root vegetables grown for both their roots and leafy greens. They thrive in cooler temperatures and nutrient-rich soil.
watering_reminder: Water consistently for tender roots.
care_tips: Harvest greens young and roots when about 2 inches wide.

name: Yams
details: Yams are starchy tubers similar to sweet potatoes but with rougher skin and less sweetness. They require a long warm growing season.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially during dry spells.
care_tips: Harvest before the first frost and cure before storage.

name: Sweet Potato
details: Sweet potatoes are warm-season tubers known for their sweetness and nutrition. They grow from slips, not seeds, and need plenty of sun.
watering_reminder: Water consistently but allow soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Cure harvested roots in a warm, humid place for sweetness.

name: Radish
details: Radishes are fast-growing root vegetables with a spicy flavor. Ideal for spring and fall planting with moist, well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist for best flavor.
care_tips: Harvest promptly to prevent woody texture.

name: Asparagus
details: Asparagus is a perennial vegetable that takes time to establish but offers years of harvest. Best grown in full sun and rich, well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist, especially during first year.
care_tips: Don’t harvest in the first year; allow ferns to grow and strengthen roots.

name: Broccoli
details: Broccoli is a cool-season vegetable grown for its edible flower heads. It prefers full sun and rich, moist soil.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist, especially during head formation.
care_tips: Harvest heads before yellow flowers appear.

name: Cauliflower
details: Cauliflower is a cool-season crop grown for its edible head. It requires consistent moisture and prefers cooler temperatures.
soil_type: fertile, well-drained, rich in organic matter
watering_reminder: Ensure even moisture for white, compact heads.
care_tips: Tie outer leaves over the head to keep it white and tender.

name: Petunia
details: Petunias are vibrant annual flowers known for their trumpet-shaped blooms. They thrive in sunny locations and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly but avoid overwatering.
care_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to promote new blooms.

name: Geranium
details: Geraniums are hardy annuals known for their colorful blooms and distinct scent. They prefer sunny spots and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Allow soil to dry slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Pinch back stems to encourage bushier growth.

name: Zinnia
details: Zinnias are colorful, fast-growing flowers ideal for sunny gardens. They attract pollinators and bloom throughout the summer.
watering_reminder: Water at the base to prevent mildew.
care_tips: Deadhead to extend blooming period.

name: Dahlia
details: Dahlias are tuberous perennials with dramatic blooms in many shapes and colors. They bloom from midsummer to frost.
watering_reminder: Water deeply, especially during dry spells.
care_tips: Stake tall varieties and deadhead regularly.

name: Begonia
details: Begonias are versatile flowering plants that thrive in shade and provide colorful blooms and attractive foliage.
watering_reminder: Avoid water on leaves to prevent mildew.
care_tips: Pinch back for bushier growth; protect from wind.

name: Cosmos
details: Cosmos are daisy-like flowers with delicate foliage, loved for their easy growth and attractiveness to pollinators.
watering_reminder: Tolerates drought, water when dry.
care_tips: Deadhead regularly to extend bloom period.

name: Pansy
details: Pansies are cheerful cool-season flowers known for their colorful, face-like blooms and cold tolerance.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Remove spent flowers for continuous blooms.

name: Snapdragon
details: Snapdragons are tall, spiky flowers that thrive in cooler weather and attract bees and hummingbirds.
watering_reminder: Keep evenly moist, not soggy.
care_tips: Pinch back stems to encourage branching.

name: Impatiens
details: Impatiens are popular shade-loving annuals with bright, cheerful blooms that thrive in moist environments.
soil_type: moist, well-drained, rich in organic matter
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Avoid letting soil dry out; mulch to retain moisture.

name: Alyssum
details: Alyssum is a low-growing, fragrant flower that forms a carpet of tiny blooms and attracts beneficial insects.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
care_tips: Trim back after blooming to encourage regrowth.

name: Parsley
details: Parsley is a versatile herb used in a variety of cuisines. It grows well in containers or garden beds and prefers consistent moisture.
soil_type: moist, well-drained, rich in organic matter
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest leaves regularly to encourage growth and prevent bolting.

name: Sage
details: Sage is a perennial herb with fragrant, gray-green leaves used in cooking and medicine. It prefers drier conditions and good air circulation.
watering_reminder: Avoid overwatering; allow soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Trim back woody stems yearly to maintain healthy growth.

name: Dill
details: Dill is an annual herb known for its feathery leaves and use in pickling and cooking. It bolts quickly in heat.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist for best leaf flavor.
care_tips: Harvest before flowering to maximize leaf flavor.

name: Tarragon
watering: Once a week or when soil is dry
details: Tarragon is a perennial herb with a slightly sweet, anise-like flavor. It prefers dry, well-drained soil and doesn't like wet roots.
watering_reminder: Allow topsoil to dry out between watering sessions.
care_tips: Prune regularly to encourage bushier growth and prevent flowering.

name: Lemongrass
details: Lemongrass is a tropical herb used in Asian cooking. It grows in clumps and can be grown in containers or garden beds.
watering_reminder: Water frequently, especially in hot weather.
care_tips: Trim back regularly and bring indoors before frost.

name: Bay Laurel (Bay Leaf)
details: Bay Laurel is an evergreen shrub known for its aromatic leaves used in cooking. It prefers drier soil and good drainage.
watering_reminder: Avoid overwatering; ensure good drainage.
care_tips: Prune regularly to shape and encourage leaf growth.

name: Fennel
details: Fennel is a flavorful herb and vegetable with a licorice-like taste. Both the bulb and fronds are edible.
watering_reminder: Water consistently, especially during bulb formation.
care_tips: Avoid planting near dill or cilantro to prevent cross-pollination.

name: Stevia
details: Stevia is a natural sweetener with leaves that are much sweeter than sugar. It prefers warm climates and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Do not overwater; let soil dry slightly between watering.
care_tips: Trim regularly to promote bushiness and sweet leaf production.

name: Lovage
details: Lovage is a tall perennial herb with a flavor similar to celery. It is used in soups and stews and grows well in cooler climates.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Cut back after flowering to encourage fresh growth.

name: Petunia
details: Petunias are popular annual flowers known for their bright, trumpet-shaped blooms. They thrive in containers and garden beds.
watering_reminder: Water regularly but allow soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead spent blooms to encourage continuous flowering.

name: Geranium
details: Geraniums are hardy flowering plants with vibrant blooms and scented foliage, ideal for pots and borders.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
care_tips: Pinch stems for bushier growth.

name: Zinnia
details: Zinnias are colorful, fast-growing annuals that add brightness to any garden and are great for attracting pollinators.
watering_reminder: Water at the base to avoid fungal issues.
care_tips: Remove faded flowers to encourage more blooms.

name: Dahlia
details: Dahlias are tuberous plants known for their stunning, intricate blooms in various colors and sizes.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist, avoid overwatering tubers.
care_tips: Stake tall varieties for support.

name: Begonia
details: Begonias are versatile plants with waxy foliage and colorful blooms, perfect for shade gardens and hanging baskets.
watering_reminder: Avoid getting water on leaves to prevent mildew.
care_tips: Remove dead flowers and leaves regularly.

name: Cosmos
details: Cosmos are delicate-looking, daisy-like flowers that bloom profusely and thrive in poor soil.
watering_reminder: Water during dry spells.
care_tips: Thin seedlings to encourage airflow.

name: Pansy
details: Pansies are cool-weather annuals known for their cheerful, face-like flowers in a variety of colors.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist.
care_tips: Deadhead regularly for longer blooming.

name: Snapdragon
details: Snapdragons produce tall spikes of flowers in a variety of colors and thrive in cool weather.
watering_reminder: Water when top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Pinch back early growth for bushier plants.

name: Impatiens
details: Impatiens are shade-loving annuals with bright blooms and are ideal for flower beds and containers.
watering_reminder: Do not let soil dry out completely.
care_tips: Fertilize every two weeks for best blooms.

name: Alyssum
details: Alyssum is a low-growing, fragrant flower often used as ground cover or edging in gardens.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, but don’t overwater.
care_tips: Trim back mid-season for another bloom cycle.

name: Eggplant
details: Eggplant is a warm-season vegetable known for its glossy purple skin and meaty texture.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist, not soggy.
care_tips: Mulch and weed regularly for best growth.

name: Green beans
details: Green beans are tender annual vegetables that grow quickly and are easy to cultivate in warm weather.
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Harvest frequently to encourage more production.

name: Pole beans
details: Pole beans are climbing varieties that require support but yield more over time than bush beans.
watering_reminder: Water regularly during flowering and pod set.
care_tips: Provide a trellis or stake for vines to climb.

name: Lima beans
details: Lima beans, also known as butter beans, grow best in warm weather and produce edible pods filled with starchy seeds.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist during flowering.
care_tips: Harvest when pods are plump and green.

name: Brussels sprouts
details: Brussels sprouts are a cool-season crop that produces edible buds along a tall stalk.
watering_reminder: Consistent moisture is key for good head formation.
care_tips: Harvest from the bottom up once sprouts are firm and 1 inch in diameter.

name: Okra
details: Okra is a warm-season vegetable known for its edible seed pods and tall, hibiscus-like plants.
watering_reminder: Water deeply during dry spells to promote pod growth.
care_tips: Harvest young pods frequently to keep plants productive.

name: Artichoke
details: Artichokes are perennial plants grown for their edible flower buds. They prefer mild climates and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply and regularly, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Cut back after harvest to encourage new growth in the following season.

name: Snow peas
details: Snow peas are flat, edible-podded peas that are harvested early. They grow best in cool weather.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Pick pods when they are flat and tender, before they begin to fill with peas.

name: Sugar snap peas
details: Sugar snap peas are sweet, crisp peas that can be eaten pod and all. They thrive in cool weather.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially during flowering and pod formation.
care_tips: Harvest young pods for the best flavor and texture.

name: Edamame (soybeans)
details: Edamame are young, green soybeans often eaten as a snack or in salads. They grow well in warm weather.
watering_reminder: Keep soil evenly moist but avoid overwatering.
care_tips: Harvest when pods are filled with beans but still green.

name: Corn
details: Corn is a tall, warm-season plant that produces large ears of edible kernels. It requires full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply and regularly, especially during dry spells.
care_tips: Harvest when kernels are plump and the husks are dry.

name: Rhubarb
details: Rhubarb is a perennial vegetable known for its tart, edible stalks. Only the stalks are edible; the leaves are toxic.
watering_reminder: Keep soil consistently moist, especially during hot weather.
care_tips: Harvest only the stalks, and leave the leaves to continue growing.

name: Bok choy
details: Bok choy, also known as Chinese cabbage, is a cool-season vegetable with a mild, sweet flavor. It grows quickly in cool weather.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Harvest when leaves are young and tender for the best flavor.

name: Napa cabbage
details: Napa cabbage is a type of Chinese cabbage with soft, crinkly leaves. It prefers cool temperatures and moist, fertile soil.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest when the head is firm and fully formed.

name: Chinese broccoli (Gai Lan)
details: Chinese broccoli, or Gai Lan, is a leafy vegetable with thick, crunchy stems. It thrives in cooler weather and is used in Asian cuisine.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest when stems are tender but before flowers bloom for the best taste.

name: Malabar spinach
details: Malabar spinach is a heat-tolerant, fast-growing vine with thick, succulent leaves. It thrives in warm climates and is often used in salads.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Harvest leaves regularly to encourage new growth.

name: Tatsoi
details: Tatsoi is a mild, tender leafy green often used in salads and stir-fries. It grows best in cool weather and can tolerate light frost.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist and water consistently.
care_tips: Harvest when leaves are young for the best flavor.

name: Mizuna
details: Mizuna is a mild, peppery leafy green used in salads or cooked dishes. It grows quickly in cool weather and is frost-tolerant.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest leaves regularly for continuous growth.

name: Celeriac
details: Celeriac, also known as celery root, is grown for its edible, knobby root. It prefers cool weather and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply and consistently.
care_tips: Harvest when roots are large and firm.

name: Celery
details: Celery is a cool-season vegetable grown for its crisp, edible stalks. It requires regular watering and rich, moist soil.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest leaves regularly for continuous growth.

name: Turnip
details: Turnips are cool-season root vegetables that grow quickly in well-drained soil. The root is eaten while the leaves can be used in salads or cooked.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep the soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest roots when they reach 2-3 inches in diameter.

name: Rutabaga
details: Rutabagas are root vegetables that have a mild, sweet flavor. They grow best in cooler temperatures and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Harvest when the root is 3-5 inches in diameter.

name: Horseradish
details: Horseradish is a pungent root vegetable known for its spicy flavor. It thrives in well-drained, fertile soil and prefers cool climates.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest roots in fall before the first frost.

name: Jerusalem artichoke (Sunchoke)
details: Jerusalem artichokes, also known as sunchokes, are tubers with a nutty, sweet flavor. They are easy to grow and are tolerant of a variety of soil conditions.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Harvest tubers after the first frost for the best flavor.

name: Ginger
details: Ginger is a tropical plant grown for its spicy, aromatic root. It prefers warm, humid environments and rich, well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water consistently but avoid waterlogging the soil.
care_tips: Harvest roots after the plant has fully matured and before frost.

name: Turmeric
details: Turmeric is a tropical plant known for its aromatic and spicy root. It requires a warm climate and well-drained soil to thrive.
watering_reminder: Water consistently but avoid waterlogging the soil.
care_tips: Harvest roots after the plant has fully matured and before frost.

name: Wasabi
details: Wasabi is a spicy root vegetable often used in Japanese cuisine. It grows best in cool, shaded areas with well-drained, slightly acidic soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Keep the plant shaded and ensure it has constant moisture.

name: Taro
details: Taro is a tropical plant grown for its starchy, edible root. It prefers warm temperatures, moist soil, and partial to full sunlight.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, especially in dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest tubers when the plant begins to die back.

name: Jicama
details: Jicama is a root vegetable known for its crisp texture and mildly sweet flavor. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly but avoid overwatering.
care_tips: Harvest tubers before the first frost.

name: Daikon radish
details: Daikon radish is a mild-flavored root vegetable used in Asian cuisine. It grows best in cool, well-drained soil and full sunlight.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain moisture in the soil.
care_tips: Harvest before the plant matures and the root becomes woody.

name: Vietnamese coriander
details: Vietnamese coriander is a tropical herb with a spicy, peppery flavor. It thrives in warm, humid conditions and grows well in partially shaded areas.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain moisture in the soil.
care_tips: Trim leaves to encourage fresh growth, especially after harvesting.

name: Cuban oregano
details: Cuban oregano is a robust herb with a strong flavor, often used in Caribbean and Latin American cuisines. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Prune regularly to maintain shape and encourage branching.

name: Curry plant
details: Curry plant is an aromatic herb with a distinctive curry scent, often used to flavor dishes in Mediterranean and Indian cuisines. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Prune regularly to promote fresh growth and maintain shape.

name: Borage
details: Borage is an herb known for its bright blue flowers and cucumber-like flavor. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it ideal for garden borders.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain soil moisture but avoid overwatering.
care_tips: Harvest flowers regularly to encourage new growth.

name: Anise hyssop
details: Anise hyssop is a fragrant herb with licorice-like flavor, often used in teas and cooking. It grows well in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, ensuring the soil doesn't become too dry.
care_tips: Cut back the plant after flowering to encourage new growth.

name: Chervil
details: Chervil is a delicate herb with a mild aniseed flavor. It is often used in French cuisine and prefers cool, moist environments with partial shade.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain moisture, especially in dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest leaves regularly to encourage fresh growth.

name: Perilla (Shiso)
details: Perilla, also known as Shiso, is a flavorful herb with a unique taste, commonly used in Japanese and Korean dishes. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately to keep the soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Prune regularly to maintain a bushy shape and encourage fresh growth.

name: Epazote
details: Epazote is a pungent herb native to Central America. It is commonly used in Mexican cooking to flavor beans and other dishes, and it prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, keeping the soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Trim back dead leaves and harvest leaves regularly to keep the plant healthy.

name: Summer savory
details: Summer savory is an herb with a peppery flavor, often used in savory dishes and to season beans and meats. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, ensuring soil doesn't dry out completely.
care_tips: Pinch back to encourage branching and more leaves.

name: Winter savory
details: Winter savory is a hardy herb with a robust, peppery flavor. It grows well in full sun and well-drained, slightly alkaline soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Prune regularly to prevent the plant from becoming woody.

name: Strawberry
details: Strawberries are sweet, juicy fruits that grow on low-lying plants. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun, making them perfect for home gardens.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist, especially during fruiting.
care_tips: Mulch around plants to retain moisture and keep berries clean.

name: Raspberry
details: Raspberries are sweet, tangy fruits that grow on thorny bushes. They prefer well-drained, slightly acidic soil and need full sun for best growth.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially during dry spells, to keep soil consistently moist.
care_tips: Trim dead canes after fruiting to encourage healthy new growth.

name: Blackberry
details: Blackberries are juicy, sweet-tart fruits that grow on thorny canes. They prefer full sun and slightly acidic, well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Keep soil moist, but avoid waterlogging. Mulch around roots to maintain moisture.
care_tips: Prune back spent canes after fruiting to promote healthy new growth.

name: Blueberry
details: Blueberries are sweet, tangy berries that grow on bushes. They require acidic, well-drained soil and benefit from full sun exposure.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Use mulch to keep soil moist and reduce weed growth.

name: Gooseberry
details: Gooseberries are tart, green to red fruits that grow on thorny bushes. They prefer well-drained, slightly acidic soil and full sun to partial shade.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially in dry periods, to keep soil moist.
care_tips: Prune back old wood to encourage healthy new growth and better fruit production.

name: Currant
details: Currants are tart, small berries that grow on woody shrubs. They prefer well-drained, slightly acidic soil and thrive in full sun to partial shade.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain soil moisture, especially during dry spells.
care_tips: Prune old canes to encourage new growth and better fruit production.

name: Fig
details: Figs are sweet, succulent fruits that grow on large, deciduous trees. They require well-drained soil and full sun to produce the best fruit.
watering_reminder: Water deeply, especially during dry spells, to ensure consistent moisture.
care_tips: Mulch around the base to retain moisture and protect roots from heat.

name: Dwarf lemon tree
details: Dwarf lemon trees are compact fruit trees that produce tangy lemons. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun and are perfect for container gardening.
watering_reminder: Water consistently to keep the soil moist, but avoid waterlogging.
care_tips: Prune occasionally to maintain shape and promote healthy growth.

name: Dwarf lime tree
details: Dwarf lime trees are small trees that produce fragrant, tangy limes. They thrive in well-drained soil, full sun, and are perfect for containers or small gardens.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to maintain moist but well-drained soil.
care_tips: Prune regularly to maintain a compact shape and remove dead or damaged growth.

name: Ground cherry (Physalis)
details: Ground cherries are small, sweet fruits encased in papery husks. They grow on low plants and thrive in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist, but avoid waterlogging.
care_tips: Harvest when husks are papery and fruits turn yellow or orange.

name: Cape gooseberry
details: Cape gooseberries are small, sweet-tart fruits enclosed in a papery husk. They grow on small, sprawling plants and prefer well-drained soil and full sun.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil evenly moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Harvest when the husks are papery and the fruit turns yellow or orange.

name: Passionfruit (on trellis)
details: Passionfruit vines are vigorous climbers that produce aromatic, tangy fruits. They require a trellis or support and thrive in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, ensuring the soil remains moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Train the vines on a trellis to maximize fruit production and ensure proper air circulation.

name: Melon (Cantaloupe)
details: Cantaloupe melons are sweet and aromatic fruits that grow on sprawling vines. They need full sun, warm temperatures, and well-drained soil for optimal growth.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, ensuring the soil stays moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Ensure proper air circulation to avoid mold. Harvest when the melon develops a sweet aroma.

name: Watermelon
details: Watermelon is a large, refreshing fruit with high water content. It thrives in full sun, warm temperatures, and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, especially during dry periods.
care_tips: Harvest when the watermelon produces a deep hollow sound when tapped and the skin is firm.

name: Honeydew
details: Honeydew melons are sweet, pale green fruits that grow on sprawling vines. They require full sun, warm temperatures, and well-drained soil to thrive.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, ensuring consistent moisture.
care_tips: Harvest when the melon is slightly soft to the touch and has a sweet fragrance.

name: Grapes
details: Grapes are versatile, sweet fruits that grow on woody vines. They require full sun, well-drained soil, and regular pruning for optimal fruit production.
watering_reminder: Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Prune regularly to maintain healthy vines and promote better fruit production.

name: Kiwi (hardy variety)
details: Hardy kiwi vines produce small, smooth-skinned fruits that are sweet and tangy. These vines need full sun, well-drained soil, and protection from frost during the early stages of growth.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, ensuring the soil is consistently moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Prune back hard to encourage new growth and ensure better fruit yield.

name: Loquat
details: Loquats are small, orange fruits with a sweet-tart flavor. These trees require full sun, well-drained soil, and moderate watering to thrive.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Prune to shape the tree and remove any dead or diseased wood.

name: Pomegranate
details: Pomegranates are fruit-bearing shrubs or small trees that thrive in hot, dry climates. The fruit has a sweet-tart flavor and is packed with seeds.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, but allow the soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Prune to maintain shape and encourage fruit production. Remove any dead branches.

name: Pineberry
details: Pineberries are white strawberries with a pineapple-like flavor. They are hardy and grow in similar conditions to regular strawberries, requiring full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, ensuring the soil stays moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Mulch around the base of the plant to maintain soil moisture and suppress weeds.

name: Nasturtium
details: Nasturtiums are vibrant, easy-to-grow flowers with edible leaves and flowers. They thrive in poor soil and full sun, making them ideal for containers or garden beds.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
toxicity: toxic if ingested in large quantities
care_tips: Deadhead regularly to encourage continued blooming and prevent self-seeding.

name: Larkspur
details: Larkspur is a tall, elegant flowering plant known for its vibrant spikes of color. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, and is commonly used in borders and cut flower arrangements.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, ensuring the soil remains moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Cut back spent blooms to encourage reflowering and maintain plant health.

name: Calendula
details: Calendula, also known as pot marigold, is a hardy, bright-colored flower often used in herbal medicine. It grows best in full sun with well-drained, fertile soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead regularly to encourage more blooms throughout the growing season.

name: Coneflower (Echinacea)
details: Coneflower, or Echinacea, is a native perennial that attracts pollinators and has medicinal properties. It thrives in full sun with well-drained soil and can tolerate drought once established.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, ensuring the soil stays moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Cut back spent flowers to promote continued blooming and remove diseased foliage.

name: Columbine
details: Columbine is a charming perennial known for its unique, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it ideal for woodland gardens.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Cut back after blooming to encourage fresh growth and prevent reseeding.

name: Rudbeckia (Black-eyed Susan)
details: Rudbeckia, commonly known as Black-eyed Susan, is a perennial flowering plant with bright yellow petals and a dark center. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply once a week, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage continued blooming.

name: Salvia
details: Salvia is a versatile and aromatic flowering plant that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil. It is known for its colorful spikes of flowers, often purple or red, and attracts pollinators.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry out between waterings.
care_tips: Prune back after flowering to encourage new growth.

name: Scabiosa (Pincushion flower)
details: Scabiosa, also known as Pincushion flower, is a charming perennial with unique round flowers resembling pincushions. It prefers full sun and well-drained, moderately rich soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, ensuring the soil does not stay overly wet.
care_tips: Deadhead regularly to promote new blooms and maintain plant health.

name: Coreopsis
details: Coreopsis, also known as tickseed, is a perennial plant known for its bright yellow or orange flowers. It grows best in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water moderately, ensuring the soil remains moist but not waterlogged.
care_tips: Cut back after blooming to maintain plant health and promote new growth.

name: Foxglove
details: Foxglove is a striking biennial or short-lived perennial with tall spikes of tubular flowers. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained, moist soil.
watering_reminder: Water consistently, especially during dry periods, but avoid waterlogging.
care_tips: Prune back after blooming to prevent excessive reseeding.

name: Delphinium
details: Delphinium is a tall, flowering plant with striking blue, purple, or white flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially during dry periods, but ensure the soil does not stay soggy.
care_tips: Stake plants early to prevent them from falling over and cut back after flowering.

name: Yarrow
details: Yarrow is a hardy perennial known for its feathery foliage and clusters of small flowers. It grows well in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply but infrequently, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Cut back dead blooms to promote new growth and prevent reseeding.

name: Gaillardia (Blanket flower)
details: Gaillardia, or Blanket flower, is a vibrant perennial known for its red, orange, and yellow petals. It grows best in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, but allow the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to extend the blooming period and keep the plant tidy.

name: Tithonia (Mexican sunflower)
details: Tithonia, also known as Mexican sunflower, is an annual plant with bright orange flowers. It grows best in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Pinch back the stems to encourage bushier growth and more blooms.

name: Amaranth
details: Amaranth is an annual plant known for its vibrant red, purple, or gold flowers and edible leaves and seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, ensuring the soil is kept moderately moist.
care_tips: Harvest the seeds when they turn brown for edible use, or allow them to self-seed for the next season.

name: Cleome (Spider flower)
details: Cleome, also known as Spider flower, is a striking annual with large, spidery flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, but make sure the soil drains well.
care_tips: Pinch back the top of the plant to encourage bushier growth.

name: Heliotrope
details: Heliotrope is a fragrant flowering plant known for its clusters of purple, white, or pink flowers. It grows well in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply but infrequently, ensuring the soil dries slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Remove spent blooms regularly to encourage continuous flowering.

name: Verbena
details: Verbena is a popular annual that produces vibrant flowers in a variety of colors. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water deeply, allowing the soil to dry between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage more blooms and improve plant health.

name: Lantana
details: Lantana is a hardy, colorful flowering plant that blooms in clusters of orange, yellow, pink, or purple. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Trim back after blooming to encourage more flowers and keep the plant tidy.

name: Sweet pea
details: Sweet pea is a fragrant flowering vine that produces clusters of delicate, colorful flowers. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, but ensure the soil is well-drained to prevent waterlogging.
care_tips: Pinch back to encourage more flowers and remove spent blooms to prolong the blooming season.

name: Monstera deliciosa
details: Monstera deliciosa, also known as the Swiss cheese plant, is a popular houseplant with large, glossy leaves that develop characteristic holes as they mature. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry to the touch.
care_tips: Provide a moss pole or trellis for support as the plant grows taller.

name: Dieffenbachia
details: Dieffenbachia, commonly known as dumb cane, is a tropical houseplant known for its bold, variegated foliage. It thrives in indirect light and prefers well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
care_tips: Avoid overwatering and ensure proper drainage to prevent root rot.

name: Bird of Paradise
details: Bird of Paradise is a striking tropical plant known for its large, dramatic leaves and bright, bird-like flowers. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, allowing the soil to dry slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Keep the plant in a warm, humid environment for best results.

name: Areca palm
details: The Areca palm, also known as the butterfly palm, is a graceful houseplant with feathery fronds that thrive in bright, indirect light. It prefers well-drained soil and humidity.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
care_tips: Mist the plant regularly to maintain humidity, especially in dry climates.

name: Rubber plant (Ficus elastica)
details: Rubber plant is a popular houseplant with glossy, dark green leaves and a strong, upright growth habit. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Dust the leaves occasionally to keep them clean and help the plant photosynthesize more effectively.

name: Peperomia
details: Peperomia is a small, attractive houseplant known for its thick, fleshy leaves and compact growth. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
care_tips: Avoid overwatering and ensure proper drainage.

name: Alocasia
details: Alocasia, also known as elephant ear, is a striking tropical plant with large, arrow-shaped leaves. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Ensure high humidity for best growth and avoid letting the soil dry out completely.

name: Anthurium
details: Anthurium, also known as the flamingo flower, is a popular houseplant known for its shiny, red spathes and green leaves. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Provide adequate humidity and avoid overwatering to keep the plant healthy.

name: Chinese Evergreen (Aglaonema)
details: Chinese Evergreen is a low-maintenance, easy-care houseplant with attractive variegated foliage. It thrives in low to moderate light and prefers well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Avoid direct sunlight and let the soil dry between waterings.

name: Boston fern
details: Boston fern is a popular houseplant known for its lush, feathery fronds. It thrives in high humidity and indirect light, preferring well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil moist, especially in dry climates.
care_tips: Keep the plant in a humid environment and mist regularly to maintain its health.

name: Maidenhair fern
details: Maidenhair fern is a delicate and graceful plant with light, airy fronds. It thrives in high humidity and indirect light, preferring consistently moist soil.
watering_reminder: Keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Ensure high humidity for best growth, mist regularly if air is dry.

name: Prayer plant (Maranta)
details: Prayer plant is known for its unique leaf movements, which fold up at night like hands in prayer. It prefers bright, indirect light and consistently moist, well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Keep the plant in a humid environment and avoid direct sunlight.

name: Dracaena
details: Dracaena is a hardy and low-maintenance houseplant with striking long, arching leaves. It thrives in indirect light and prefers dry soil between waterings.
watering_reminder: Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil feel dry.
care_tips: Avoid overwatering and place in indirect sunlight for best growth.

name: Croton
details: Croton is a vibrant, colorful houseplant known for its strikingly bold, variegated leaves. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry.
care_tips: Provide high light conditions to maintain vibrant leaf color.

name: Ponytail palm
details: Ponytail palm is a unique, drought-tolerant plant known for its bulbous base and long, spiky leaves. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water only when the soil is dry to the touch.
care_tips: Avoid overwatering and place in a well-lit area for optimal growth.

name: Jade plant
details: Jade plant is a succulent with thick, glossy, dark green leaves. It is a low-maintenance plant that prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water when the soil is dry to the touch.
care_tips: Allow the soil to dry out between waterings to avoid root rot.

name: Nerve plant (Fittonia)
details: Nerve plant is known for its striking veined leaves, with vibrant pink, white, or red veins. It prefers indirect light and high humidity, thriving in moist soil.
watering_reminder: Keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Ensure high humidity for the plant's best growth and avoid dry air.

name: String of pearls
details: String of pearls is a unique, trailing succulent known for its bead-like leaves. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained soil, requiring minimal watering.
watering_reminder: Water when the soil is dry to the touch.
care_tips: Allow the soil to dry out completely between waterings.

name: Air plant (Tillandsia)
details: Air plants are unique plants that do not require soil. They absorb moisture and nutrients from the air, thriving in bright, indirect light with good air circulation.
watering_reminder: Soak for 20-30 minutes once a week and shake off excess water.
care_tips: Ensure proper air circulation and avoid waterlogging.

name: Cast iron plant (Aspidistra)
details: The cast iron plant is a tough, low-maintenance houseplant known for its dark green, glossy leaves. It thrives in low light and is highly resistant to neglect.
watering_reminder: Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil feel dry.
care_tips: Avoid overwatering and place in a low-light area if possible.

name: Chayote
details: Chayote is a tropical vine with edible, pear-shaped fruits. It thrives in warm climates with plenty of sun and requires regular watering to maintain healthy growth.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Provide a trellis or support for the vine to grow upwards.

name: Cress (Garden Cress)
details: Garden cress is a fast-growing, peppery-tasting herb that is commonly used in salads and sandwiches. It requires minimal care and thrives in cool, moist conditions.
watering_reminder: Keep the soil consistently moist, but avoid waterlogging.
care_tips: Harvest young leaves for the best flavor and to promote continuous growth.

name: Hops
details: Hops are climbing vines used primarily for beer production, with aromatic flowers. They require well-drained soil, ample sunlight, and regular watering to thrive.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Provide a trellis or structure for the vines to climb.

name: Sweet William (Dianthus)
details: Sweet William is a beautiful flowering plant known for its vibrant colors and clove-like scent. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it perfect for borders and containers.
watering_reminder: Water regularly but allow the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
care_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage more blooms.

name: Tuberose (Polianthes tuberosa)
details: Tuberose is a fragrant, bulbous plant known for its stunning white flowers. It thrives in warm climates with full sun and requires well-drained soil and regular watering.
watering_reminder: Water regularly to keep the soil moist but not soggy.
care_tips: Ensure good drainage to avoid waterlogging.

name: Hibiscus
details: Hibiscus is a tropical plant known for its large, colorful flowers. It thrives in warm climates with plenty of sunlight and requires regular watering and well-drained soil.
watering_reminder: Water regularly, especially during dry spells, but avoid waterlogging.
care_tips: Prune after flowering to promote healthy growth and more blooms.
